alert.note: Alert for Lenawee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorms will impact much of Lenawee County through 745 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms 7 miles west of Addison, or 8 miles northeast of Hillsdale, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cement City around 705 PM EDT. Hudson and Addison around 710 PM EDT. Onsted and Clayton around 715 PM EDT. Adrian around 725 PM EDT. Blissfield and Britton around 740 PM EDT. Deerfield around 745 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Seneca, Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Macon, Lime Creek, Munson, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Ridgeway, Palmyra and Tipton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
